Nerangs.ab: yaϑā ahū vairiiō dō andar rāh bē gōwišn u-š ō ī gāh ī zōtān šawišn u-š tarsāgīhā pad ōhrmazd ud amahraspandān ud ān ī ahlawān frawahr bē abāyēd gōwišn.
"He has to recite the yaϑā ahū vairiiō twice on the way, and to go to the place of the zōt. He must respectfully speak to Ohrmazd, the Amhraspandān and the frawahr of the orderly ones."

ab.ab: "then coming near the seat, climbs upon the seat while reciting 2 Ahuna Vairiia. And the assistant priest, if he has stepped down from the seat (and) released the bāj, (and) is standing outside the pāvī, then taking the bāj, he comes back inside the pāvī of the table (and) recites as many Ahuna Vairiia as have been recited by the chief priest. Then both of them remember together in a low tone: humata hūxta huuaršta humanašnǝ hugauuašnǝ hukunašnǝ īn xšnūmaine:"
